Articles.Content:
So I'm much more comfortable creating in SketchUp (that most basic of programs). But I also want to play with the big boys on Blender, and have been groping around the program figuring a few things out. My issue right now is that Blender refuses to let me open the files I've exported out of SketchUp (.dae format) without crashing. The file will load. I will be inside this model. When I try zooming out, it crashes. I can however open the .dae file on Preview and look at it (no holes, all faces are the right direction).

Any tips, tricks, ideas, help? I want to texture this model (or at least try, heh).
Export sketchup using the Obj file to blender.. thats what i have to do.
